get.summary: List Scheduler and Game Rooms info by Game

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Game name to filter schedulers.

post.summary: Creates new scheduler version and switch it to active version.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the scheduler.

patch.summary: Patch a scheduler and switch it to active version.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the scheduler.

parameters.name: schedulerName
parameters.description: Scheduler name where the rooms will be added.

parameters.description: Scheduler version to be queried (query param).

Scheduler name to be deleted

parameters.name: schedulerName
parameters.description: Scheduler Name

get.summary: List operations based on a scheduler.

parameters.name: schedulerName
parameters.description:
Scheduler name that the operations are part of.
NOTE: On http protocol, this operates as a path param.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
Optional parameter for enabling operations sorting.
General `order_by` string syntax: <field> (<asc|desc>)
Default value is `created_at desc`
NOTE: On http protocol, this operates as a query parameter.

get.summary: Get operation based on scheduler name and operation ID

parameters.name: schedulerName
parameters.description:
Scheduler name that the operations are part of.
NOTE: On http protocol, this operates as a path param.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description:
ID of the requested operation.
NOTE: On http protocol, this operates as a path param.

post.summary: Cancel operation based on scheduler name and operation ID

parameters.name: schedulerName
parameters.description: Scheduler name where the operation relies on.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: Operation identifier to be canceled.

get.summary: Given a Scheduler, returns it's versions

parameters.name: schedulerName
parameters.description: Scheduler name whose versions the client wants to fetch

status.description:
Current status of the operation.
TODO(gabrielcorado): change to enum.

definitionName.description: Name of the operation being executed.

lease.description: Operation lease. This is an optional field since not all operations have a lease.

schedulerName.description: Scheduler identifier that the operation is from.

input.description: Input the data that was sent by client.

executionHistory.description: ExecutionHistory is the execution details filled by Maestro.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

min.title: Min is the minimum number of game rooms that a scheduler should have

max.title: Max is the maximum number of game rooms that a scheduler should have

policy.title: Policy is the autoscaling policy that scheduler should follow

min.title: Min is the minimum number of game rooms that a scheduler should have

max.title: Max is the maximum number of game rooms that a scheduler should have

type.title: Type is the policy type to the scheduler

parameters.title: Parameters is the autoscaling arguments to guide the policy execution

v1CancelOperationResponse.description: Empty response of the cancel operation request.

imagePullPolicy.description: Image pull policy: Always, Never and IfNotExists.

command.description: Container command to be called when container is instantiated.

v1Container.description: Container is the struct that defines a game room container configuration.

valueFrom.description: Source for the environment variable's value. Cannot be used if value is not empty.

fieldRef.description:
Container environment variable name using field reference, supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, `metadata.labels['<KEY>']`, `metadata.annotations['<KEY>']`,
spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.hostIP, status.podIP, status.podIPs.

secretKeyRef.description: Container environment variable value using a secret key reference contained in the namespace.

fieldPath.description:
The field path of the pod: supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, `metadata.labels['<KEY>']`, `metadata.annotations['<KEY>']`,
spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.hostIP, status.podIP, status.podIPs.

v1ContainerEnvironmentValueFromFieldRef.description: Container environment valueFrom using field reference.

name.description: Name of the secret contained in the scheduler namespace.

v1ContainerEnvironmentValueFromSecretKey.description: Container environment valueFrom using secret key reference.

protocol.description: Protocol used to expose the port (TCP, UDP, SCTP).

game.description: Game the new scheduler will be part of.

spec.description: The spec object defines all the game room container configurations and spec of the scheduler.

portRange.description: The port range object describes what is the port range used to allocate game rooms.

maxSurge.title: The max surge of new rooms, used to scale and update

roomsReplicas.description: The rooms replicas defines the desired number of Game Rooms in a scheduler.

autoscaling.title: The autoscaling defines the autoscaling and its policy to be followed

v1CreateSchedulerRequest.description: Scheduler is the struct that defines a maestro scheduler.

schedulerName.description:
Target scheduler name.
NOTE: On http protocol, this operates as a path param.

roomName.description:
Target room name.
NOTE: On http protocol, this operates as a path param.

success.title: Flag indicating if the forward process was successful or not

message.title: Message from forwarding response (currently always blank)

Target scheduler name.

roomName.description:
Target room name.
NOTE: On http protocol, this operates as a path param.

success.title: Flag indicating if the forward process was successful or not

message.title: Message from forwarding response (currently always blank)

name.title: Forwarder name used to identify it. Must be unique within the scheduler

enable.title: Defines if the forwarder is going to receive events or not

timeout.description: Timeout of a request in milliseconds.

ipv6Label.description: Game room ipv6_label, this field is deprecated and only exists for maestro v9 contract compatibility reasons.

versions.title: List of versions for an scheduler

v1GetSchedulersInfoResponse.title: List Scheduler and Game Rooms Info Response

ttl.description:
Lease time to live in RFC3999 format UTC. if the current time is greater than this value,
the lease is probably expired.

status.description:
Current status of the operation.
TODO(gabrielcorado): change to enum.

definitionName.description: Name of the operation being executed.

lease.description: Operation lease. This is an optional field since not all operations have a lease.

schedulerName.description: Scheduler identifier that the operation is from.

v1ListOperationItem.description: The List Operation Item object representation.

pendingOperations.description: List of the scheduler pending operations.

activeOperations.description: List of the scheduler active operations.

finishedOperations.description: List of the scheduler finished (with error or not) operations.

v1ListOperationsResponse.title:
The list operation route response/reply
There's a list for each operation major status

game.description: Game the new scheduler will be part of.

spec.description: The spec object defines all the game room container configurations and spec.

portRange.description: The port range object describes what is the port range used to allocate game rooms.

maxSurge.title: The max surge of new rooms, used to scale and update

roomsReplicas.description: The rooms replicas is the desired number of rooms that maestro should keep available.

autoscaling.title: The autoscaling defines the autoscaling and its policy to be followed

v1NewSchedulerVersionRequest.description: Scheduler is the struct that defines a maestro scheduler.

operationId.description: Operation ID, further this id can be used to consult its state.

createdAt.description: DateTime is the time when the event occurred.

event.description: Event describe what happened in this event.

v1OperationEvent.description: OperationEvent object represent an execution event.

min.title: Min is the minimum number of game rooms that a scheduler should have

max.title: Max is the maximum number of game rooms that a scheduler should have

policy.title: Policy is the autoscaling policy that scheduler should follow

imagePullPolicy.description: Image pull policy: Always, Never and IfNotExists.

command.description: Container command to be called when container is instantiated.

v1OptionalContainer.description:
OptionalContainer is the struct that defines a game room container configuration.
This message is used to patch container configuration.

terminationGracePeriod.description: The game room termination grace period.

containers.description: The container object array defines all the game room container configurations.

v1OptionalSpec.description:
OptionalSpec is the specifications of the scheduler, with relevant info about what is being used.
This message is used to patch spec configuration.

spec.description: The spec object defines all the game room container configurations and spec.

portRange.description: The port range object describes what is the port range used to allocate game rooms.

maxSurge.title: The max surge of new rooms, used to scale and update

roomsReplicas.title: Rooms Replicas is the desired number of rooms

v1PatchSchedulerRequest.description: PatchSchedulerRequest is the struct that defines a partial update of a maestro scheduler.

operationId.description: Operation ID, further this id can be used to consult its state.

v1PatchSchedulerResponse.description: PatchSchedulerResponse have the operation response id that represents the operation creted to this change.

roomOccupancy.title: RoomOccupancy is the policy parameters to execute rooms occupancy policy

v1Port.description: Port represents a game room port.

v1PortRange.description:
Port range is the range definition that the rooms will use. If a scheduler
defines its range as 0-1000 (start-end), it is guarantee that all rooms be
within this range.

readyTarget.title: ReadyTarget represents the number of rooms ready rate that the scheduler should keep

name.description: Name is an unique identifier for the scheduler.

game.description:
Game is the "scope" where the scheduler will be placed. It is required, and
games name are unique.

portRange.description: Port range for the scheduler rooms.

roomsReplicas.title: Rooms Replicas is the desired number of rooms

roomsReady.description: Number of game rooms in Ready state.

roomsOccupied.description: Number of game rooms in Occupied state.

roomsPending.description: Number of game rooms in Pending state.

roomsTerminating.description: Number of game rooms in Terminating state.

isActive.title: Flag indicating if the version is active or not

createdAt.title: Specifies when the version has been created

v1SchedulerVersion.title: Represents the version of a Scheduler

name.description: Name is an unique identifier for the scheduler.

game.description:
Game is the "scope" where the scheduler will be placed. It is required, and
games name are unique.

portRange.description: Port range for the scheduler rooms.

roomsReplicas.description: Rooms Replicas is the desired number that a Scheduler maintains.

v1SchedulerWithoutSpec.title:
Scheduler message used in the "ListScheduler version" definition. The "spec" is not implemented
on this message since it's unnecessary for the list function

terminationGracePeriod.description: The game room termination grace period.

containers.description: The container object array defines all the game room container configurations.

v1Spec.description: Spec is the specifications of the scheduler, with relevant info about what is being used.

version.title: Version that will be activate in Scheduler
